documents.document: A coven of poets join forces to defeat a Greek god.
An archaeologist is climbing up the side of a giant thighbone. It has been her childhood dream.
A silent showgirl falls in love with regret.
A poppy that can destroy prime numbers grows in a Burmese garden. A homeless person searches for it.
By touching a particular face located in Wales, you can reach another world. It is ruled by a dental hygienist.
An ambitious Young Adult writer falls into a river filled with words. A schoolmistress tries to save her.
A hazel tree celebrates the Fourth of July.
A necromancer steals metaphors and hides them inside a lighthouse.
A nurse is walking from Miami to an elm tree in Alexandria.
A princess believes it is her destiny to kill letters of the alphabet.
A prime minister hears of a lagoon filled with honey, and wishes to sail her warship across it.
Every day, a beauty therapist in Illinois turns into a concert hall during her lunch break.
A queen is singing in a crystal forest.
In Russia is a desert in which every grain of sand is a volcano.
Twelve software developers are on a secret mission. Their aim is to steal a gigantic emerald.
A duchess owns an illuminated manuscript which depicts every tsar's sigh by a schoolteacher.
A 16th century textbook describes a universe entirely filled with late capitalism.
An emerald library whispers to a game show host: "I wish I was a geiger counter."
In Colorado there is a cypress tree which used to be a Welsh congressman.
A Catalan nun is sentenced to death by a vice president for writing a book about free will.
On All Hallow's Eve you suddenly become as wise as Wittgenstein.
A software developer slowly turns into a shopping trolley. Nobody notices.
A caliph marries the International Space Station. They have one child: A daughter who is made of infinity.
A doctoral student is found dead in a cinema. Beside the body is a toenail and a puddle of Jell-O. Can you explain what happened?
A party of lake monsters are going on a quest. Their aim is to reach the 16th century.
A nihilistic solicitor falls in love with management consulting.
A naturopath suddenly appears in Red Square during the Russian Revolution. She feels out of place.
A lawyer is standing perfectly still at the bottom of the Marianas Trench.
A beautiful stonemason plays a game of dominoes with a pyramid.
Forty-nine archivists devise a world where everything is oysters.
A geisha steals everyone whose name begins with the letter M and hides them inside a crystal chapel.
A PhD thesis causes anyone who reads it to believe they are a tortoise shell.
An Anatolian political action committee seeks donations from sapphires.
A queen receives an unusual gift from her cat: A candle that can compose operas.
A congresswoman wants to steal every FabergÃ© egg in Hawaii.
A caliph wishes to catalogue every duck egg in Baltimore.
A novelist has a rare gift: He can understand the language of sea serpents.
A Marxist finds a leather-bound book containing instructions for building a staircase out of cathedrals.
There is a creature in Sicily that is half caterpillar and half dragon. It has the mind of a 10th century sheik.
A Madagascan philosopher dies while writing a novel about women named Diane.
A professor of English literature is dancing in a hospital. She is thinking about starlight. There is a lobster standing right behind her.
A pope waltzes with a frying pan inside a haunted waterfall.
A porcelain aircraft carrier is sailing on a sea of Britney Spears.
A Vietnamese steering committee convenes a meeting about quinces that lasts for 8,500 years.
A unicorn appears in a sexual health clinic. Then tiny bats begin raining from the sky.
Ten children play a game in which the aim is to become a rhinoceros.
An Italian courtesan discovers a pair of spectacles which let her see every act of forgiveness happening around the world.
A Kenyan necromancer passes a law against puppets.
By concentrating on a lump of coal, a Canadian tsar is able to destroy music.
A mechanical library appears over Borneo. A sociologist is talking to it.
In Florida there is a window which is driving the kids to soccer practice.
A queen owns a painting by Michelangelo which depicts every fart that has ever happened.
In Venice there is a chrysanthemum that smells like snakes.
A bisexual French necromancer buys a tiny glass sphere that lets her sense the presence of Attention Deficit Disorder.
Bernie Sanders has a girlfriend. The girlfriend is https://t.co/h18x4x1NBo.
There is an army major in Switzerland with a wardrobe instead of a liver.
A travel agent is turning into potatoes.
A pear tree as beautiful as the North Star grows in a Sicilian garden. A novelist writes a manuscript about it.
A book collector hears of a toilet that can destroy the stars, and devotes his life to finding it.
A pharmacist in Seattle is falling in love with men whose name begins with the letter S.
A baroness discovers that science fiction does not exist, and is relieved.
A cocktail waitress invents a better version of capitalism: Snoring.
A Norwegian grandmother listens to a xylophone that plays every song ever heard in Prague.
An American high school teacher sees a cloud in the shape of a cathedral.
A movie producer is being chased by a fireplace in a Sudanese desert.
An ancient order of professors come together to worship Star Wars.
A congressman is masturbating in the belly of an eel.
An Ethiopian politician is building a hospital that is filled with Santa Claus.
A desert suddenly falls from the sky in the East Village.
A kangaroo sleeps in a terracotta rainforest.
A sorceress turns into every labyrinth in Milwaukee.
A penniless chef makes a milkshake flavored with social media.
A butler counts to ten. In that time, he lives for twelve years as a 16th century novelist.
A dictator hears of a chestnut tree made of chocolate creams, and yearns to eat it.
A swan kidnaps a queen. It demands a ransom of 7,700 cities.
A Czechoslovakian innkeeper plants a seed which grows into a waterlily made of Moonlight Sonata.
An electric guitar is elected Governor of Utah.
In Siberia, onions start raining from the sky. An elf is responsible.
A woman owns an essay by Spinoza on the subject of the Moon.
In San Diego there is a book that is made of angels.
There is a tornado in Dar es Salaam. It sucks up croissants.
A toilet whispers to a girl: "I feel so handsome."
An anthropologist finds an opal which allows him to turn everything into arrogance.
An ash tree appears before Judas Iscariot. It says: "Don't be worried."
A baby is born in Finland with Bruegel's Fall of Icarus painted on its face.
A Scottish book describes a way of having sexual intercourse that turns you into a pine tree.
A girl discovers that everything is being masterminded by Wikipedia.
An Algerian countess invents a machine that will let her have sexual intercourse with sexual frustration.
A congressman is writing a list. It has three items: A grand piano, a clock, and an exclamation mark.
A Spanish vice president passes a law that everyone must drink clam juice.
An ostrich lays an egg. A rattlesnake is inside it.
An army officer sets out on a journey to a marble city.
A planet is thinking about ears in a railway station.
A philosopher meets a spider with wigs instead of legs.
Your mother tells you that you are a tsarina in a 12th century Californian city.
A dingo is eating a rectangle.
An Instagram celebrity suddenly turns into an Olympic stadium. His lover is secretly pleased.
A 14-year-old duchess hatches a plan to poison pretentiousness.
In Barcelona is a juniper tree whose every leaf is a gold mine.
An eagle made of candy canes is born in Sydney.
